value.0: I welcome you into the ShadowGuard, my <brother/sister>...
Would you like some help in your mission?
As you wish.
Very good, <mister/missus> <LastName>
Sorry, but it looks like you've already found someone to help you out. You'll have to excuse me.
<< Activates "N_TALK_SWITCH" if "N_MODULE_STAGE" is 9. USING THIS FOR TESTING AT THE MOMENT! >>
Welcome to the ShadowGuard, <FullName>... We are proud to have you amongst us...
<< Set owner's journal quest to "JT_ST_2_MAIN" >>
<< Activates "N_TALK_SWITCH" if "N_MODULE_STAGE" is 2. >>
Please speak with Overlord Vhorkas, <FirstName>. He must have words with you before we depart.
We will have time to speak further once we reach safety! For now, we must get to the Voyager... Come, <FirstName>, we must hurry!
<StartAction>[Markius hurries to Harkon's side, appearing quite concerned over his well being.]</Start> Harkon, are you alright?
<StartAction>[The sorcerer shakes his head roughly.]</Start> The Crimson Prophet! Where is he, Markius?! We... we must not let him escape with that jewel!
<StartAction>[Markius turns towards the western banks of the Docks, pointing in the direction of a fleeing ship.]</Start> The Prophet is gone, Harkon... We... we could not stop him in time...
<StartAction>[Harkon swears loudly.]</Start> Get the ShadowGuard to the Voyager, Markius! We have to set sail after the Prophet immediately!
Harkon, there is no way we can stop the Prophet now... His ship flies with an unnatural wind behind it, giving it a speed we could never match in the Voyager...
<StartAction>[Harkon seethes angrily, but seems to relent.]</Start> So be it, then! We shall simply have to track him down and recover it later... Come! Let us be away from this accursed city!

<StartAction>[Harkon looks to you, and you feel contempt in his glance.]</Start> Bring the child of Okaris as well, I suppose... Vhorkas will want to speak to <him/her> upon our arrival at Zhantara...
Of course, Harkon... <StartAction>[Markius turns towards you.]</Start> <FirstName>, it seems there is little hope remaining for Ghaarak. You must come with us to our ship!
There is nowhere left to go, <FirstName>! The other ships have already departed, and the Docks shall soon fall to the enemy! You must come with us!

<StartAction>[Markius seems flustered by your response.]</Start> There is no time for this, <FirstName>! The Crimson Followers are entering the Docks as we speak, and the rest of the city is poised to fall as well!
Once we are away from the city, I promise to tell you more of our purpose, but for now we do not have time! You must come quickly!
For Rakha and the glory of the Sharakhan Empire, these foul demons shall fall!
Stand back, <FirstName>... We have the Prophet cornered, but he may yet be dangerous...
I must go now to face the Crimson Prophet, <FirstName>. I wish you luck, and may Rakha keep you safe.
<StartAction>[Markius motions towards his companions, who quickly depart through the gate.]</Start>
You will be safe upon the Voyager, <FirstName>. I can spare one of my companions to escort you to our ship, but the others I will need if we are to stop the Crimson Prophet.
Please speak with each of my companions, and choose which you would like to be your escort. Once you have done so, we will make our way to the docks.
I cannot aid you at the moment, <FirstName>. Harkon requires my strength if he is to stand against the Crimson Prophet. Rest assured that my companions will keep you in good company.
I suggest speaking with each of them, <FirstName>, to see which of my companions most suits your preference.
Please be quick about it, <FirstName>. We do not have long, and the Crimson Prophet must still be confronted. Go now, and choose your companion.
<StartAction>[You come upon Markius Albright, speaking fervently with a beautiful young Elven woman.]</Start> Kara, what news do you carry of the Market District? How has it fared in this battle?

Not well, I'm afraid. All of Ghaarak seems poised to fall to the Crimson Prophet's followers. Markius, we must get to the Voyager quickly... the docks have not been overrun yet, but it is only a matter of time..
What of the Crimson Prophet? Has he been sighted in the Market yet?
Yes... the Prophet appeared a short time ago, making his way towards the Docks. I believe he is attempting to make his escape from Ghaarak...
Markius, we do not have time to tarry here! I need the ShadowGuard's aid to stop the Crimson Prophet before it is too late! He must not escape the city with that jewel he took from the Treasury!
<StartAction>[Markius turns towards you.]</Start> <FirstName>, it is good that you have come. Ghaarak is in grave danger...

Most of the city lies in ruins, and few remain alive to defend the walls. On all sides, Ghaarak is beset by enemies... the Crimson Followers from within, and barbarian hordes from without. I fear Ghaarak is doomed, <FirstName>...

That is difficult to say, but it appears the Crimson Prophet is growing in strength. He has always proved troublesome to the Empire, but never before has he managed to accomplish such an assault as this...
Ghaarak's fall proves the Prophet has grown to be a far greater threat than we could ever have imagined... One has only to look at the destruction he has wrought here to realize that fact.
Then we may be able to aid you, <FirstName>. We would like to see you kept in safety as well.

I'm afraid not... but we may yet live to strike back at another time, of our choosing. <FirstName>, my companions and I can help you escape Ghaarak before it falls, and we may be your only hope of survival.
As of yet, the docks have not fallen to the enemy. We have a ship there, the Voyager, which can take us to safety. I would like for you to accompany us to the Docks, <FirstName>.
We must hurry, for the Crimson Prophet is still on the loose, and the docks will not remain safe for long. We have to reach the Voyager before Ghaarak falls...
We do not know as of yet, but we fear he may intend to use that gem from the Grand Hall for some fell purpose. Harkon and I intend to see he does not escape Ghaarak with the orb in tow...

That is a complicated matter, and one that will have to wait. For now, just know that we are allies in this time of darkness, and will see to your safety. When we reach calmer grounds, we can speak more.
Your father was a friend and mentor to my companions as well as myself. We would like for you to come with us, for we intend to have revenge against those who took Okaris' life.
Are you sure of this, <FirstName>? Ghaarak is not safe anymore, and you will be in considerable danger. I ask you to please reconsider, and accept our aid, at least for the time being...

Now that the gate to the Market District is open, we must head there at once, <FirstName>. It is imperative for you to reach safety, and for me to aid Harkon in tracking down the Crimson Prophet before it is too late.
I can take you as far as the Market District gate, if you wish for me to accompany you. Will you allow me to extend my protection to you, <FirstName>?
He is a close ally of mine, <FirstName>, a sorcerer of great power. You may trust him, for his foremost purpose is to see an end to the Crimson Prophet and his evil plans.
I wish I had time to explain matters further, but we must leave at once. Let's ensure that you reach safety, then we will have a chance to speak further.
The Imperial District seems to have come under quite an attack, <FirstName>. Matters in Ghaarak are far worse than I had expected, and the need to get you to safety all the greater.

It appears the gate to the Market District has been sealed. If we to pass through it, and find our way to my ship at the Docks, we will have to discover a way to overcome the gate's magical protection.
I would like to accompany you on this task, <FirstName>. I believe I can offer you assistance in this matter, as well as offer you protection should the Crimson Prophet make a move against you.
I believe so, <FirstName>. This attack has all the markings of the Prophet's involvement, though I have never seen destruction by his hand on this scale. We should increase our guard considerably.
Will you allow me to accompany you to the Voyager, <FirstName>? It should prove a safe haven for you for the time being.
<StartAction>[Markius seems annoyed by your choice, but nods his head.]</Start> Very well, <FirstName>. I am going to head into the Imperial District.
As you wish, <FirstName>. I am going to make my way into the Imperial District. Should you change your mind, you may find me in the Imperial Academy.
I'm glad you have agreed to let me aid you, <FirstName>. Come, let us be on our way.

It appears you have already found yourself a companion, <FirstName>. I believe you are in good hands, and my talents can be put to another use. Should you need my aid later, though, feel free to come speak with me.
Farewell, <FirstName>. May Rakha keep you in his blessings.
Please ask your questions quickly, <FirstName>. The Prophet may even now be moving against you...
Well, my allies and I will be able to protect you upon the Voyager, and we are quite formidable indeed. Should the danger grow greater, we can always escape by sea, as well.
With the Crimson Prophet still on the loose, I imagine we are all in great danger. We will do what we can to stop the Prophet's plans, but it would be wise for you to stay on your guard.
It appears that much of the Imperial District has been overrun by the Crimson Prophet's followers. Who knows what that fiend has in store, or what danger you may be in?

That's difficult to say, but I have heard the sounds of battle coming from the Imperial District. I fear the Crimson Prophet may already be at work, so there is no telling what troubles may lie ahead...
You are quite perceptive, <FirstName>. I am part of an elite Imperial group, known simply as the ShadowGuard. We carry out orders from Emperor Rakha, acting in the interests of the Sharakhan Empire.
Again, you impress me with your perception, <FirstName>. Yes, it is true that we have had our eye on you for some time. You see, your father, Okaris <LastName>, helped found the ShadowGuard...

The ShadowGuard is a secretive group, our existence known only to a select few. I would like to speak on this matter further with you, but for now, we must find a place of safety. Then, we may talk further.

My allies and I have been watching the Crimson Prophet's actions for quite some time. He has made many appearances throughout the north, always preceding some sort of attack against Imperial interests.
The Prophet has proven a sly opponent, eluding us at every turn. Even now, I do not know what his true motives are, save that he seems bent on bringing havoc and destruction to our Empire.
If the Prophet has seen fit to kill your father, he may very well come after you, <FirstName>. It is important that you remain wary of this danger.
<StartAction>[Markius wears the mark of concern as you approach.]</Start>

<StartAction>[The man extends his hand to help you stand straight as your knees buckle slightly from the stress of all that has happened in the last few moments.]</Start> Are you alright, <FirstName>? Can you stand?

Calm yourself, <FirstName>. I am Markius Albright... we met briefly in the Market District after the attempt on your life, and I was trying to uncover the plot against your father. It... it appears my efforts have gone in vain, though...
Be at ease, <FirstName>. It is I, Markius Albright... we were working together to discover the plot against your father... but it appears our efforts have gone in vain...
<< Set owner's journal quest to "JT_PREL_MARK" >>

I am Markius Albright, <FirstName>. We met briefly in the Market District after the assassination attempt on your life, and I was trying to uncover the plot against your father. It... it appears my efforts have gone in vain, though...
I am Markius Albright, <FirstName>. We were working together on the assassination plot against your father, but... but it appears our efforts were in vain...
<< Set owner's journal quest to "JT_PREL_MARK" >>
Yes I am. I was attempting to unravel the plot against your father, but... but it appears my efforts were in vain...
Yes, it is I, <FirstName>. Take a moment to recover your wits, for you seem to have been through a terrible ordeal...
<StartAction>[Suddenly, it all comes back to you. Your father's worried expressions, the strange red medallion, the explosion of your father's estate...]</Start>

Don't be a fool, <FirstName>! <StartAction>[Markius motions towards the fires raging within the Imperial Estate.]</Start> Your father is dead, and you may be in quite a bit of danger, so I suggest you accept my aid...
Judging from what I have seen here, it seems Crimson Prophet has orchestrated this attack against your family... and now he sends his legions to destroy Ghaarak once and for all...
<StartAction>[Markius' eyes flare in anger.]</Start> Were you not the child of a man I greatly respected, <FirstName>, I would challenge you for such a blasphemy against Okaris <LastName>!
But it would be a dishonor to your father's memory, and we have other matters more pressing than such foolishness at the moment...
The Prophet likely saw your father as an ideal target, for his motives have always been to strike chaos into the heart of the Sharakhan Empire.
I can understand your desire to avenge your father's death, but you must be wary, <FirstName>...
The followers of the Crimson Prophet have begun an invasion into Ghaarak, and you be assured that those fanatics shall not stop until all within the city are dead!
It is imperative that you reach a place of safety, <FirstName>, and I may be able to aid you in this matter...
Please, you must heed my warnings, <FirstName>! I mean you no harm, and I believe you will need my help before this is all finished...
Your bravery is to be commended, <FirstName>, but the Crimson Prophet is a powerful man. Courage alone would not give you the strength to fight against his might.
In time, you may be able to stand against the Prophet, but to do so, you will need to survive. I would like to ensure that you do so...

I would like to take you to my ship, the Voyager, waiting at the docks of the city. There, I believe you will be safe from danger, at least until I have time to figure out how best to keep you out of harm's reach.

<StartAction>[Markius nods grimly, and you notice an expression of sorrow upon his face.]</Start> Yes, <FirstName>, I believe he is. There is little left of the Imperial Estate... There is no way he could have survived...
<StartAction>[A look of sorrow passes over Markius' face.]</Start> I'm afraid your father is dead, <FirstName>... There is no way he could have survived a blast such as that which took the Estate...
We have little time for words at the moment, <FirstName>! Come! Let us finish off the foul followers of the Crimson Prophet, then we may speak further!
<StartAction>[Kneeling before a towering statue of Emperor Rakha, Markius Albright is lost in his meditations...]</Start>

<StartAction>[Still oblivious to your presence, Markius intones the Oath of Servility.]</Start> May Rakha be my blade, may He always guide my hand... May Rakha be my shield, may I never falter in His service...
May Rakha be my guide, may He always light my path... May Rakha be my lord, may I never fail His purpose...
<StartAction>[As Markius finishes his prayer to the Almighty Rakha, he opens his eyes and finally takes notice of your presence.]</Start>
<StartAction>[Turning his steely gaze towards you, Markius bows deeply before you.]</Start> Greetings, <FullName>, and well met. May Rakha find this meeting to His welcome.
What business do you wish to discuss with me, <FirstName>?
<StartAction>[Markius nods, bows in farewell, and returns to his meditations.]</Start>

<StartAction>[Markius' eyes grow grim.]</Start> The Final Initiation... that is a trial that you will likely find us all to be hesitant to tell... But I suppose you should have some warning of what to expect...

The trial is different for each of us, drawing upon our own strengths and weaknesses. But rest assured that Emperor Rakha will ensure you are capable of standing next to the ShadowGuard with both honor and dignity.
Beyond that, I'm afraid there is little more that I can tell you. Trust in your skills and your faith to the Almighty Rakha, and you should do well enough...
I suppose I can aid you with that. Which member of our organization do you wish to know more of?
<StartAction>[A small smile of admiration comes across Markius' face.]</Start> The Overlord is a great man, learned both in the Empire's customs, and the art of warfare...
I love the Overlord as a father, and would follow his orders to whatever ends. Put your trust in Overlord Vhorkas, <FirstName>. He shall see that your father's death does not go unpunished...
Well, Tarin can be quite troublesome at times, meddling in the affairs of criminal organizations as he does. I cannot count the number of times we have had to rescue him from some form of trouble...

But the Halfling has a good heart, and there are few who have travelled the Northern Reaches as extensively as he. I am proud to call Tarin my companion, despite the vast differences in our natures...
<StartAction>[Markius' face grows a bit darker, and you notice a hint of a frown at the corner of his lips.]</Start> Kara's a dark soul, though she does have her uses within our rank...

I cannot claim to fully trust her, for Kara serves her purposes alone. You would do wise to keep that in mind, as well, <FirstName>. She can be counted on to be an ally in battle, but beware her charms...
<StartAction>[Markius seems lost in thought for a long moment, and at first you do not believe he will answer. Finally, he looks upon you once more, a dark expression upon his face.]</Start>
That is a question no one has asked me for quite some time, but I suppose I can trust you with the tale... Very well, <FirstName>. I shall tell you how I came to be among the ShadowGuard.

I was born to the wealthy Albright family, one of the most prominent noble homes of the Northern Reaches. We were one of the first among the noble houses of the frontier to accept the rule of the Sharakhan Empire.
My father was a good man, embracing the ideals of the Almighty Rakha with heart and soul. Under our family's rule, the Albright Barony flourished in peace for nearly a decade.
I was sent to the Imperial Academy of Ghaarak upon reaching my tenth year, to be taught the art of swordsmanship by your father, Okaris <LastName>.

Determined to make my family proud, I quickly advanced through the Academy ranks, excelling all my peers in the art of combat. But... but even my skill with the blade could not stop the disaster soon to strike my home...
Word reached my ears that a mysterious sorcerer had taken residence in my father's plantation home, and many of our family's subjects feared his presence.
I wished to journey home to confront this new mystery, but my father encouraged me to stay and finish my training... and... and like a good son, I complied...
Had I known the truth, I would have hastened to my father's side, for this mysterious sorcerer was none other than the Crimson Prophet himself...

Spewing his foul words of betrayal and deceit, the Crimson Prophet began an uprising against my father, the first of his many fell deeds. The Albright Barony burned in the fires of the Prophet's new army, my family along with it.

So, you see, my family became the first victims of the Crimson Prophet's rebellion, and I have never forgotten his treachery against my father. On the day my family fell, I swore to hunt the Prophet to the ends of Abaran...
Several years later, your father approached me regarding a new organization designed to track down the Prophet and his cronies, and asked that I join its number.

And so I came here, to be the first ordained member of the ShadowGuard. We have hunted the Crimson Prophet mercilessly, and we shall die continuing to do so... til either he or ourselves have perished...
<StartAction>[Markius nods, seemingly lost in the memory of his past.]</Start> I suppose it is, <FirstName>... I suppose it is... But let us speak of other matters... ones not so dark as my past...
<< Set owner's journal quest to "JT_ST_1_MAIN" >>
<< Activates "N_TALK_SWITCH" if "N_MODULE_STAGE" is 1. >>
<StartAction>[Markius Albright approaches you quickly.]</Start> It is good that I have found you, <FirstName>, for it seems you are in grave danger.
<StartAction>[Markius gives you a solemn glare.]</Start> My "foolishness" may very well save your life, <FirstName>, so I suggest you curtail your arrogance and hear me out...
It is important that I speak with you now, <FirstName>, for this matter cannot be delayed. It is of the utmost importance to both you and your father.

During my investigation into the assassination attempt against you, I have uncovered some strong clues pointing towards Mikel Ravenclaw, a rather dangerous Half-Elf with ties to several roguish groups.
Rumor has it that Mikel is planning an attempt on you and your father's lives in the near future, so time may be running short.

I would have to suggest against that, <FirstName>. Until Mikel's plans are known, it might be better if you and your father were not in one another's company. Otherwise, he may launch his attack sooner than anticipated.
It appears so, though I share your skepticism that he would do so without incentive. It may yet prove that someone else is pulling Mikel's strings, but I have yet to uncover who that person could be.
We must stop Mikel before any more harm is inflicted and any other accomplices in this matter be revealed. Only then will I feel comforted that your lives are safe from danger.
You are being a fool, <FirstName>, for you place both your life, as well as your father's, in great jeopardy! But... but I cannot force you to listen to reason, I suppose...
So be it, <FirstName>. I pray Rakha guards you from danger, and should you decide otherwise after giving it some thought, return to me here. Farewell, and be safe.
As of yet, I do not have any solid proof of Mikel's guilt, merely a collection of rumors gathered throughout the city. We will need something a bit more concrete if we are to end his plans.

I would like you to travel with me to confront Mikel at the Ravenclaw Tavern in the Market District. We may be able to resolve this without bloodshed, but the threat against Magistrate Okaris must be ended.
<StartAction>[Markius turns his gaze towards you at your approach. His dark eyes burn with intensity and his hand does not stray far from the blade at his side.]</Start>
It is good to see you, <FullName>, <CUSTOM6001> of Okaris <LastName>. I pray that you have not suffered any great injury at the hands of these fiendish assassins.

<StartAction>[Markius gives you a forbidding frown.]</Start> You should be more appreciative to those who seek to aid you, <FirstName>. I fear the <LastName> family may need allies in the days to come...
<StartAction>[Markius removes a vial containing a healing salve, applying it gently to your wounds.]</Start> I would say you narrowly avoided an end to your short life, my friend.
<FullName>, I fear a terrible plot may be underway. There's been strange talk in the city as of late, something about a conspiracy.

I have heard rumors that someone in Ghaarak has reason to see your father dead, but why, I do not know. It would be a great tragedy for the Empire to lose a man such as Okaris and I intend to do what I can to stop it.
Very well, <FullName>. I can see when my aid is unwanted, so I shall investigate this affair in my own fashion. I'll take my leave of you now.
You are a fool if you believe this matter will resolve itself, <FullName>, but have it your way. I, at least, will try to put an end to this before it is too late.
<StartAction>[Markius pats the blade by his side comfortingly.]</Start> Your father and I go back quite a ways, <FullName>. He taught me in the arts of swordsmanship and the path of honor.
Okaris <LastName>, was my mentor many years ago and I remember his tutelage with great fondness. He helped me attain my position in Rahka's ShadowGuard.
<StartAction>[Markius grins slightly, an expression that seems ill suited to his solemn face.]</Start> I am glad to see you practicing caution already, <FullName>, but you may trust my motives.

I wish we could speak further, but there is trouble in the air and I had best ferret out the source. If you desire further proof of my story, you should ask your father. I'm sure he'll be willing to speak of me.
I am going to look into this matter further, and see if I may discern the culprit behind this attack. In the meantime, it would be wise for you to warn your father of the danger you are in.
<StartAction>[Markius' jaw clench's.]</Start>So be it, <FullName>. Keep safe, and avoid any unwanted attention, for these streets may remain dangerous for you.
I would recommend treading lightly and avoiding attention. Do not worry, <FullName>. There are others besides myself who have a vested interest in keeping you safe...
Keep your senses sharp, <FullName>, particularly if you are approached by anyone who appears out of place. Once I have had a chance to investigate matters further, I will find you again.
That would likely prove dangerous; Your enemies may wish to strike again. Your presence would prove more of a liability than an aid, noble as your intentions may be.
I bid you farewell, for now. Should I discover any information that would prove of importance to you or your father, I will contact you immediately. May Rakha bless you and keep you safe, <FullName>.
There is no time to talk at the moment, m'<lord/lady>! We must put an end to these assassins before it is too late!
<< Set owner's journal quest to "JT_PRELUDE" >>
I am glad we were able to bring justice to that treacherous worm, Varhun, but my heart remains uneasy, <FirstName>... I fear we have not seen the end of his foul machinations...
<FirstName>, I am sorry we were unable to uncover sufficient evidence to put Varhun away... I... I feel that I have failed you...
<StartAction>[The young man bows his head in shame.]</Start> It is true, <FirstName>. I only hope my failure shall not bring harm to your father...
<StartAction>[Markius seems to take heart at your words.]</Start> Perhaps you are right, <FirstName>... though I do not know what more we can do...
You are kind to say so, <FirstName>... Still, I wish there was more that I could do...
I am going to investigate matters a bit further, and see what I may uncover. For the meantime, you should go warn your father, in case Varhun has set in motion some dire plan...

I wish you luck, <FirstName>, and I shall pray for Rakha to keep both you and your father safe. Please hurry and warn your father, for it would be a great tragedy if some ill fate were to befall either of you...
<StartAction>[Markius turns and heads quickly away...]</Start>

<StartAction>[Markius Albright hails your approach, bowing in a knightly fashion.]</Start> Greetings to you, <FullName>. It is good to see you have managed to avoid death at the hands of your would be assassins.

So it seems Chancellor Varhun, your father's own aide, has been plotting against Magistrate Okaris. <FirstName>, we must speak with Captain Anagril of this before it is too late. We must stop any attack upon your father.

If you insist on being such a fool, then so be it! I have had my share of dealing with your childishness! Should you learn a bit of maturity, perhaps we can speak further... if you manage to live long enough, that is...
I can understand your desire to warn Magistrate Okaris, but Varhun may well discover our knowledge of his plot. We may have only a short time before he rids himself of any incriminating evidence...
Very well. Go warn your father, and please be careful. Varhun may already have set his plans into place...
Very well. Should you change your mind, I will be waiting here. Farewell, and good luck.
Of course. Come, let us be on our way...
Mikel Ravenclaw's plans must be stopped before they come to fruition, <FirstName>. I would like to accompany you to Ravenclaw's Tavern, where we may discover the nature of his plans.

<StartAction>[Markius gives you a scathing glare.]</Start> If you wish to risk your life, as well as your father's, for such foolishness, then feel free to do so! Do not speak with me again, unless you have come to your senses!
As you wish, though I would suggest you do not tarry for long. Who knows what Mikel Ravenclaw has in store for you and your father?
Very well, <FirstName>. Should you decide you need my aid at a later time, I will be here. Feel free to come speak with me at any time.
Lead the way, <FirstName>. I will lend what aid I can in this affair.
It appears you are a bit preoccupied with another companion at the moment, <FirstName>. Why don't you complete your current business, and return to me later?
<< Set owner's journal quest to "JT_PREL_MARK" >>
<< Activates "N_TALK_SWITCH" if "N_MODULE_STAGE" is 0. >>
<< This conversation node does nothing but reset the variable "N_TALK_SWITCH" >>

Comment.value: Default dialogue when the henchman is a member of the player's party.

value.0: What do you wish of me, <FirstName>?
What part of my inventory would you like to manage, <FirstName>?
Which item would you like me to unequip?
Very well, <FirstName>. I have unequipped all my items.
As you wish, <FirstName>. I have successfully unequipped <CUSTOM10001>.
I am sorry, <FirstName>, but I do not have an item in that inventory slot.
Which inventory slot would you like me to equip an item in?
Please tell me which of my items you would like me to equip.
As you wish, <FirstName>.
I'm sorry, <FirstName>, but I was unable to equip that item.
Very well. Just give me one moment to sort out my inventory...
Here all the items I currently possess. <StartAction>[You may select any of the items below if you would like to take the item from the henchman.]</Start>
As you wish, <FirstName>.
Very well. Just give me one moment to sort out my inventory...
Which item would you like to give me? <StartAction>[Select an item from the list to give to your henchman.]</Start>
Thank you, <FirstName>.
You may do as you please with my gear, <FirstName>.
As you wish, <FirstName>. I hope that we may continue to work with one another at a later time, but for now I bid you farewell.
Should you decide that you do indeed need my aid, I will be waiting in the Imperial Academy. Seek me out there should you feel you need my assistance.
I am afraid I cannot depart your company just yet, <FirstName>. Come, let us be on our way.
My services are at your command, <FirstName>.
Very well, <FirstName>.
Very well, <FirstName>.
I will try to heal you even if I am being attacked at close range.
Very well, I will heal you only if I am not in hand-to-hand combat.
As you wish.
I hope this is a wise decision, as I am far more skilled on the front lines of battle, but I shall do as you command.
I can do that. When the combat begins I'll rush in and use melee weapons.
Of course. When the combat begins I'll stay back and attack with my ranged weapons from a distance. I'll switch weapons if the enemies get too close.
Sure. What would you like me to do?
Very well. I will avoid melee combat unless I am cornered.
I like your style, <FirstName>. I didn't know you had such a streak within you, but I must say I am impressed.
That may be hard to judge, but I shall do my best.
Very well, I'll wait until the last possible moment!
Very well. I will do what I feel is best.

Varhun's death should signal an end to the threat against you and your father, but it might be wise for us to go to Magistrate Okaris now. My suggestion would be to head to the Imperial Estate, but do as you wish.
It appears Varhun has bested us, <FirstName>. I fear we can do little more against him, for the evidence has been destroyed. We will simply have to hope that luck remains with you and your father...
I believe we have Varhun now. It should only be a matter of confronting the Chancellor at this point. Come, let us put an end to this...
I believe you were wise to enlist the aid of Captain Anagril. He seems to be a decent man. Let us see what we can uncover in Varhun's chambers.
I'm not so sure that confronting Varhun was the wisest decision... He may now have time to rid himself of any evidence. We can only hope that we still find some proof of his guilt.

I have to admit I am quite surprised to learn that a high ranking Imperial official such as Chancellor Varhun would be involved in a matter like this. I believe we are going to have to confront the Chancellor on this issue.
I suppose bloodshed was inevitable, considering the fact Mikel desired your death. Let's see if Mikel's chamber holds any information regarding his motives for plotting against you and your father.
We've gotten this far without bloodshed, so perhaps we can yet avoid bloodshed. Why not speak with Mikel, and see what he has to say about the assassination attempt?
You did well in securing aid from Officer Ganolin. We should have an easier time of confronting Mikel Ravenclaw now. Let's head toward Ravenclaw Tavern...
We need to find some way of discovering Mikel's motives behind plotting against you and your father. We will have to be careful entering his chambers, though, for he keeps himself well guarded.
<< Set owner's journal quest to "JT_PREL_MARK" >>
<< Set owner's journal quest to "JT_PREL_MARK" >>
No, I work better alone.
Yes, I would.
Forget it! I'm not going anywhere with you!
I'm still not sure I trust you, Markius...
Why are you so interested in my safety?
I suppose I have little other choice...
Actually, I'm going to go my own path...
Will you not escort me, Markius?
Tell me about your companions.
Very well then.
How could a city of the Empire fall so quickly?
I will not end my days in this miserable place!
Is there nothing we can do to help?
What does the Crimson Prophet have in store?
Just who are you people?
Why do you have such an interest in my safety?
I'll not go anywhere with you vagabonds!
I'll find my own way out of the city.
Thanks for the offer, but I don't need your help.
Very well. I will go with you to your ship.
Who is this Harkon fellow?
Is this the work of the Crimson Prophet?
I don't trust you, Markius. I'll fend for myself...
Thank you for the offer but I'm better off alone.
I would like for you to come with me, Markius.
If I'm to trust you, I want a few answers...
How can you be so sure I'll be safe on some ship?
What kind of danger do you think I'm in?
You're more than just a friendly face, aren't you...
Let's talk about something else.
<StartAction>[Wisdom]</Start> You've been trying to recruit me, right?
My father? Why did I not know of this?
How do you know so much about this Prophet?
Stand back from me, cur!
I... I think so... Who are you? Where... where am I?
I met in the Market District, right? Markius Albright?
<StartAction>[Shake the confusion from your mind.]</Start> Markius? Markius Albright?
I warn you! Stand back or feel my wrath!
What... what happened?
<StartAction>[Remain silent.]</Start>
Tough luck for dad... He should pick weaker enemies.
Why would the Crimson Prophet kill my father?
I will have my vengeance on this Crimson Prophet!
I don't even know if you're friend or foe!
I refuse to cower from this threat!
Where do you suggest we go?
<< Set owner's journal quest to "JT_ST_1_MAIN" >>
My father is dead, isn't he?
Father! Where... where is my father?!
<< Set owner's journal quest to "JT_PREL_MARK" >>
Nothing at the moment, Markius. Thank you anyway.
Overlord Vhorkas mentioned that I might be able to learn more of the Final Initiation from you...
Very well... Let me ask you something else.
Actually, I was interested in knowing what you thought of the others here in the ShadowGuard.
Actually, I believe I would rather speak on another matter...
I wish to learn a bit more regarding Overlord Vhorkas...
I was curious to learn more about Tarin Lightfingers...
Can you tell me more regarding Kara Dy'nesh?
I was curious as to whether you could tell me a little more about yourself, Markius.
I see... Well, that is quite the tale...
I have no time for your foolish conspiracies!
I have other matters I must attend to.
Out with it, then! I don't have all day!
What is it, Markius?
He can have my father. I'll handle myself.
Mikel must be dealt with at once!
I must go warn my father immediately!
Mikel Ravenclaw would dare strike against my family?!
I've had enough of this fool's talk, worm!
Do as you like, Markius. I'm too busy.
<< Set owner's journal quest to "JT_PREL_MARK" >>
Why not turn Mikel over to the guards?
What do you propose we do?
Yes, let's pay Mikel a little visit...
<< Set owner's journal quest to "JT_PREL_MARK" >>
I'm fine now, so please leave me alone.
Go. You've served your purpose, Markius.
I'm a bit bruised, but they're only minor wounds.
I think I'm fine... thanks to you.
Any idea why those men attacked me?
How did you know I was in danger?
Mind your own affairs! I can take care of myself!
I shall keep that in mind. Leave me, Markius.
Why should my father's business concern you?
I see. So what is it you propose we do?
You were trained by my father?
I'm still not sure that I trust you...
That's ill news. We must discover who's behind this!
Quit harrying me with your words and begone!
I'm to wait idly until another attempt is made on my life?
Very well. I wish you luck in your search, Markius.
Why don't I join you in your search?
Your efforts were definitely lacking, Markius...
Perhaps we can still stop the Chancellor's plans...
Don't be so hard on yourself, Markius...
I have no time for such nonsense! Leave me be...
I should go warn my father.
Regardless, I must tell my father at once.
I will face the Chancellor alone. This is personal...
Accompany me to the Imperial Grand Hall.
Leave me, Markius! I've had enough of you.
I have other matters to attend to...
I will investigate Mikel on my own.
Very well, let's be on our way.
I would like to manage your inventory.

value.0: Let's talk about your weapon-switching tactics.

LinkComment.value: Default dialogue when the henchman is a member of the player's party.

value.0: I have no further need to change your tactics at this moment.
I don't want you to engage in close-range combat at all. Move away from the enemy if they are too close!
Be aggressive. If you see enemies getting any closer than 6 meters or so, charge with melee!
I think you should switch to melee if the enemy is at a medium distance, between 4 and 5 meters away.
Since you're so good with your missile weapon, wait until the enemy gets relatively close, say less than 3 meters, before you switch to a melee weapon.
I want you to trust your instinct as to when to switch betwen melee and missile weapons.
What do you suggest we do next?
